main event: A UFO sighting was reported on 25th February 1959 at 10:52 GMT in Brewer, Maine. The object was described as bright, low on the horizon, and appeared to move slowly down before going up. It was reported to be the size of a grapefruit.
interesting points: The witness was uncertain if the object was a balloon and thought it could possibly be an air-craft.
Jupiter was in the vicinity at the time, leading to speculation that it could have been mistaken for the object sighted.
The report speculates about the existence of a fleet of flying saucers circling the Earth at an altitude of about 80,000 feet, which would place them beyond the reach of conventional aircraft.
There was discussion about the possibility of these craft conducting reconnaissance and even landing on the far side of the moon or other planets.
The sighting of a cylindrical object, reported to be 30 to 40 feet long and hovering at a height of 100 to 150 feet, was reported by several persons in Bangor, Maine.
sighted object: bright, low-lying, slow-moving object the size of a grapefruit
witnesses: A/1C Richard, 406th Headquarters Base Police, Dow AFB, Bangor, Maine
